physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Alert, oriented x 3, NAD (No Acute Distress), RRR (Regular Rate and Rhythm), CTAB (Clear To Auscultation Bilaterally), abdomen soft, appropriately mildly tender, staples in place, warm, no edema.

Small bilateral pleural effusions and area of increased opacity in both lower lungs consistent with atelectasis/infiltrate; left subclavian line with tip in the right atrium; mild pulmonary vascular redistribution.
